fields.Pokedex: When it folds up its body and extends its wings, it looks like a jet plane. It flies at sonic speed.

fields.Name: Munchlax
fields.Pokedex: It wolfs down its weight in food once a day, swallowing food whole with almost no chewing.

fields.Name: Riolu
fields.Pokedex: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.

fields.Name: Lucario
fields.Pokedex: It has the ability to sense the auras of all things. It understands human speech.

fields.Name: Hippopotas
fields.Pokedex: It lives in arid places. Instead of perspiration, it expels grainy sand from its body.

fields.Name: Hippowdon
fields.Pokedex: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.

fields.Name: Skorupi
fields.Pokedex: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.

fields.Name: Drapion
fields.Pokedex: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.

fields.Name: Croagunk
fields.Pokedex: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.

fields.Name: Toxicroak
fields.Pokedex: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.

fields.Name: Carnivine
fields.Pokedex: It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.

fields.Name: Finneon
fields.Pokedex: After long exposure to sunlight, the patterns on its tail fins shine vividly when darkness arrives.

fields.Name: Lumineon
fields.Pokedex: It lives on the deep-sea floor. It attracts prey by flashing the patterns on its four tail fins.

fields.Name: Mantyke
fields.Pokedex: A friendly Pokémon that captures the subtle flows of seawater using its two antennae.

fields.Name: Snover
fields.Pokedex: It lives on snowy mountains. Having had little contact with humans, it is boldly inquisitive.

fields.Name: Abomasnow
fields.Pokedex: It whips up blizzards in mountains that are always buried in snow. It is the abominable snowman.

fields.Name: Weavile
fields.Pokedex: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.

fields.Name: Magnezone
fields.Pokedex: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.

fields.Name: Lickilicky
fields.Pokedex: It wraps things with its extensible tongue. Getting too close to it will leave you soaked with drool.

fields.Name: Rhyperior
fields.Pokedex: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. Geodude are shot at rare times.

fields.Name: Tangrowth
fields.Pokedex: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.

fields.Name: Electivire
fields.Pokedex: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.

fields.Name: Magmortar
fields.Pokedex: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees F from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.

fields.Name: Togekiss
fields.Pokedex: It will never appear where there is strife. Its sightings have become rare recently.

fields.Name: Yanmega
fields.Pokedex: By churning its wings, it creates shock waves that inflict critical internal injuries to foes.

fields.Name: Leafeon
fields.Pokedex: Es de las mutaciones más drásticas de Eevee ya que desarrolla estructuras que le permiten realizar la fotosíntesis o fecundar con su polen a distancia.

fields.Name: Glaceon
fields.Pokedex: Está muy bien adaptado al frio ya que su sangre tiene una sustancia anticongelante que evita que su cuerpo se congele incluso a -200ºC.

fields.Name: Gliscor
fields.Pokedex: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!

fields.Name: Mamoswine
fields.Pokedex: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.

fields.Name: Porygon-Z
fields.Pokedex: Additional software was installed to make it a better Pokémon. It began acting oddly, however.

fields.Name: Gallade
fields.Pokedex: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on its elbows.

fields.Name: Probopass
fields.Pokedex: It exudes strong magnetism from all over. It controls three small units called Mini-Noses.

fields.Name: Dusknoir
fields.Pokedex: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.

fields.Name: Froslass
fields.Pokedex: It freezes foes with an icy breath nearly -60 degrees F. What seems to be its body is actually hollow.

fields.Name: Rotom
fields.Pokedex: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

fields.Name: Uxie
fields.Pokedex: Known as “The Being of Knowledge.” It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.

fields.Name: Mesprit
fields.Pokedex: Known as “The Being of Emotion.” It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.

fields.Name: Azelf
fields.Pokedex: Known as “The Being of Willpower.” It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.

fields.Name: Dialga
fields.Pokedex: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

fields.Name: Palkia
fields.Pokedex: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.

fields.Name: Heatran
fields.Pokedex: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.

fields.Name: Regigigas
fields.Pokedex: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.

fields.Name: Giratina
fields.Pokedex: A Pokémon that is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours. It appears in an ancient cemetery.

fields.Name: Cresselia
fields.Pokedex: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

fields.Name: Phione
fields.Pokedex: A Pokémon that lives in warm seas. It inflates the flotation sac on its head to drift and search for food.

fields.Name: Manaphy
fields.Pokedex: Born on a cold seafloor, it will swim great distances to return to its birthplace.

fields.Name: Darkrai
fields.Pokedex: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

fields.Name: Shaymin
fields.Pokedex: It lives in flower patches and avoids detection by curling up to look like a flowering plant.

fields.Name: Arceus
fields.Pokedex: It is described in mythology as the Pokémon that shaped the universe with its 1,000 arms.

fields.Name: Victini
fields.Pokedex: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

fields.Name: Snivy
fields.Pokedex: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

fields.Name: Servine
fields.Pokedex: They avoid attacks by sinking into the shadows of thick foliage. They retaliate with masterful whipping techniques.

fields.Name: Serperior
fields.Pokedex: They raise their heads to intimidate opponents, but only give it their all when fighting a powerful opponent.

fields.Name: Tepig
fields.Pokedex: It blows fire through its nose. When it catches a cold, the fire becomes pitch-black smoke instead.

fields.Name: Pignite
fields.Pokedex: Whatever it eats becomes fuel for the flame in its stomach. When it is angered, the intensity of the flame increases.

fields.Name: Emboar
fields.Pokedex: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.

fields.Name: Oshawott
fields.Pokedex: The scalchop on its stomach is made from the same elements as claws. It detaches the scalchop for use as a blade.

fields.Name: Dewott
fields.Pokedex: Scalchop techniques differ from one Dewott to another. It never neglects maintaining its scalchops.

fields.Name: Samurott
fields.Pokedex: Part of the armor on its anterior legs becomes a giant sword. Its cry alone is enough to intimidate most enemies.

fields.Name: Patrat
fields.Pokedex: Extremely cautious, they take shifts to maintain a constant watch of their nest. They feel insecure without a lookout.

fields.Name: Watchog
fields.Pokedex: They make the patterns on their bodies shine in order to threaten predators. Keen eyesight lets them see in the dark.

fields.Name: Lillipup
fields.Pokedex: Es activo, sobreprotector, tranquilo y le encanta que su entrenador le preste atención. Necesitan ejercicio físico diario para estar sanos.

fields.Name: Herdier
fields.Pokedex: No es fácil de adiestrar pero es un buen vigilante, ladra al mínimo movimiento sospechoso o cuando alguien se acerca y parece peligroso.

fields.Name: Stoutland
fields.Pokedex: Es tranquilo, dócil y muy leal. Cuidan de sus seres queridos, su entrenador no dudará en dejarlo al cuidado de sus hijos si debe ausentarse.

fields.Name: Purrloin
fields.Pokedex: Its cute act is a ruse. When victims let down their guard, they find their items taken. It attacks with sharp claws.

fields.Name: Liepard
fields.Pokedex: Stealthily, it sneaks up on its target, striking from behind before its victim has a chance to react.

fields.Name: Pansage
fields.Pokedex: It shares the leaf on its head with weary-looking Pokémon. These leaves are known to relieve stress.

fields.Name: Simisage
fields.Pokedex: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

fields.Name: Pansear
fields.Pokedex: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600º F.

fields.Name: Simisear
fields.Pokedex: A flame burns inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.

fields.Name: Panpour
fields.Pokedex: It does not thrive in dry environments. It keeps itself damp by shooting water stored in its head tuft from its tail.

fields.Name: Simipour
fields.Pokedex: The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.

fields.Name: Munna
fields.Pokedex: It eats the dreams of people and Pokémon. When it eats a pleasant dreams, it expels pink-colored mist.

fields.Name: Musharna
fields.Pokedex: With the mist from its forehead, it can create shapes of things from dreams it has eaten.

fields.Name: Pidove
fields.Pokedex: These Pokémon live in cities. They are accustomed to people. Flocks often gather in parks and plazas.

fields.Name: Tranquill
fields.Pokedex: Many people believe that, deep in the forest where Tranquill live, there is a peaceful place where there is no war.

fields.Name: Unfezant
fields.Pokedex: Males have plumage on their heads. They will never let themselves feel close to anyone other than their Trainers.

fields.Name: Blitzle
fields.Pokedex: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.

fields.Name: Zebstrika
fields.Pokedex: This ill-tempered Pokémon is dangerous because when it's angry, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.

fields.Name: Roggenrola
fields.Pokedex: They were discovered a hundred years ago in an earthquake fissure. Inside each one is an energy core.

fields.Name: Boldore
fields.Pokedex: Because its energy was too great to be contained, the energy leaked and formed orange crystals.

fields.Name: Gigalith
fields.Pokedex: The solar energy absorbed by its body's orange crystals is magnified internally and fired from its mouth.

fields.Name: Woobat
fields.Pokedex: Suction from its nostrils enables it to stick to cave walls during sleep. It leaves a heart-shaped mark behind.

fields.Name: Swoobat
fields.Pokedex: Anyone who comes into contact with the ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting male experiences a positive mood shift.

fields.Name: Drilbur
fields.Pokedex: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.

fields.Name: Excadrill
fields.Pokedex: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.

fields.Name: Audino
fields.Pokedex: Its auditory sense is astounding. It has a radar-like ability to understand its surrounding through slight sounds.

fields.Name: Timburr
fields.Pokedex: These Pokémon appear at building sites and help out with construction. They always carry squared logs.

fields.Name: Gurdurr
fields.Pokedex: They strengthen their bodies by carrying steel beams. They show off their big muscles to their friends.

fields.Name: Conkeldurr
fields.Pokedex: They use concrete pillars as walking canes. They know moves that enable them to swing the pillars freely in battle.

fields.Name: Tympole
fields.Pokedex: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of these sounds to talk.

fields.Name: Palpitoad
fields.Pokedex: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to capture prey.

fields.Name: Seismitoad
fields.Pokedex: It increases the power of its punches by vibrating the bumps on its fists. It can turn a boulder to rubble with one punch.

fields.Name: Throh
fields.Pokedex: When they encounter foes bigger than themselves, they try to throw them. They always travel in packs of five.

fields.Name: Sawk
fields.Pokedex: Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their punches more destructive. Disturbing their training angers them.

fields.Name: Sewaddle
fields.Pokedex: This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.

fields.Name: Swadloon
fields.Pokedex: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.

fields.Name: Leavanny
fields.Pokedex: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.

fields.Name: Venipede
fields.Pokedex: It discovers what is going on around it by using the feelers on its head and tail. It is brutally aggresive.

fields.Name: Whirlipede
fields.Pokedex: It is usually motionless, but when attacked, it rotates at high speed and then crashes into its opponent.

fields.Name: Scolipede
fields.Pokedex: Highly aggressive, it uses the claws near its neck to dig into its opponents and poison them.

fields.Name: Cottonee
fields.Pokedex: They go wherever the wind takes them. On rainy days, their bodies are heavier, so they take shelter beneath big trees.

fields.Name: Whimsicott
fields.Pokedex: Riding whirlwinds, they appear. These Pokémon sneak through gaps into houses and cause all sorts of mischief.

fields.Name: Petilil
fields.Pokedex: Since they prefer moist, nutrient-rich soil, the areas where Petilil live are known to be good for growing plants.

fields.Name: Lilligant
fields.Pokedex: The fragrance of the garland on its head has a relaxing effect. It withers if a Trainer does not take good care of it.

fields.Name: Basculin
fields.Pokedex: Red and blue Basculin usually do not get along, but sometimes members of one school mingle with the other's schooL.

fields.Name: Sandile
fields.Pokedex: It moves along below the sand's surface, except for its nose and eyes. A dark membrane shields its eyes from the sun.

fields.Name: Krokorok
fields.Pokedex: The special membrane covering its eyes can sense the heat of objects, so it can see its surroundings, even in darkness.

fields.Name: Krookodile
fields.Pokedex: It can expand the focus of its eyes, enabling it to see objects in the far distance as if it were using binoculars.

fields.Name: Darumaka
fields.Pokedex: Darumaka's droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.

fields.Name: Darmanitan
fields.Pokedex: When weakened in battle, it transforms into a stone statue. Then it sharpens its mind and fights on mentally.

fields.Name: Maractus
fields.Pokedex: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.

fields.Name: Dwebble
fields.Pokedex: It makes a hole in a suitable rock. If that rock breaks, the Pokémon remains agitated until it locates a replacement.

fields.Name: Crustle
fields.Pokedex: It possesses legs of enormous strength, enabling it to carry heavy slabs for many days, even when crossing arid land.

fields.Name: Scraggy
fields.Pokedex: It immediately headbutts anyone that makes eye contact with it. Its skull is massively thick.

fields.Name: Scrafty
fields.Pokedex: It can smash concrete blocks with its kicking attacks. The one with the biggest crest is the group leader.

fields.Name: Sigilyph
fields.Pokedex: The guardians of an ancient city, they use their psychic power to attack enemies that invade their territory.

fields.Name: Yamask
fields.Pokedex: These Pokémon arose from the spirits of people interred in graves in past ages. Each retains memories of its former life.

fields.Name: Cofagrigus
fields.Pokedex: They pretend to be elaborate coffins to teach lessons to grave robbers. Their bodies are covered in pure gold.

fields.Name: Tirtouga
fields.Pokedex: About 100 million years ago, these Pokémon swam in oceans. It is thought they also went on land to attack prey.

fields.Name: Carracosta
fields.Pokedex: Incredible jaw strength enables them to chew up steel beams and rocks along with their prey.

fields.Name: Archen
fields.Pokedex: Revived from a fossil, this Pokémon is thought to be the ancestor of all bird Pokémon.

fields.Name: Archeops
fields.Pokedex: It runs better than it flies. It catches prey by running at speeds comparable to those of an automobile.

fields.Name: Trubbish
fields.Pokedex: The combination of garbage bags and industrial waste caused the chemical reaction that crated this Pokémon.

fields.Name: Garbodor
fields.Pokedex: They absorb garbage and make it part of their bodies. They shoot a poisonous liquid from their right-hand fingertips.

fields.Name: Zorua
fields.Pokedex: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon.

fields.Name: Zoroark
fields.Pokedex: Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.

fields.Name: Minccino
fields.Pokedex: These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They are always sweeping and dusting, using their tails as brooms.

fields.Name: Cinccino
fields.Pokedex: Their white fur feels amazing to touch. Their fur repels dust and prevents static electricity from building up.

fields.Name: Gothita
fields.Pokedex: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.

fields.Name: Gothorita
fields.Pokedex: Starlight is the source of their power. At night, they mark star positions by using psychic power to float stones.

fields.Name: Gothitelle
fields.Pokedex: They can predict the future from the placement and movement of the stars. They can see Trainers' life spans.

fields.Name: Solosis
fields.Pokedex: Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they can survive in any environment.

fields.Name: Duosion
fields.Pokedex: When their brains, now divided in two, are thinking the same thoughts, these Pokémon exhibit their maximum power.

fields.Name: Reuniclus
fields.Pokedex: These remarkably intelligent Pokémon fight by controlling arms that can grip with rock-crushing power.

fields.Name: Ducklett
fields.Pokedex: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.

fields.Name: Swanna
fields.Pokedex: It administers sharp, powerful pecks with its bill. It whips its long neck to deliver forceful repeated strikes.

fields.Name: Vanillite
fields.Pokedex: This Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy from the morning sun. It sleeps buried in snow.

fields.Name: Vanillish
fields.Pokedex: It conceals itself from enemy eyes by creating many small ice particles and hiding among them.

fields.Name: Vanilluxe
fields.Pokedex: If both heads get angry simultaneously, this Pokémon expels a blizzard, burying everything in snow.

fields.Name: Deerling
fields.Pokedex: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon's fur. People use it to mark the seasons.

fields.Name: Sawsbuck
fields.Pokedex: The plants growing on its horns change according to the season. The leaders of the herd possess magnificent horns.

fields.Name: Emolga
fields.Pokedex: They live on treetops and glide using the inside of a cape-like membrane while discharging electricity.

fields.Name: Karrablast
fields.Pokedex: When they feel threatened, they spit an acidic liquid to drive attackers away. This Pokémon targets Shelmet.

fields.Name: Escavalier
fields.Pokedex: These Pokémon evolve by wearing the shell covering of a Shelmet. The steel armor protects their whole body.

fields.Name: Foongus
fields.Pokedex: For some reason, this Pokémon resembles a Poké Ball. They release poison spores to repel those who try to catch them.

fields.Name: Amoonguss
fields.Pokedex: They show off their Poké Ball caps to lure prey, but very few Pokémon are fooled by this.

fields.Name: Frillish
fields.Pokedex: They paralyze prey with poison, then drag them down to their lairs, five miles below the surface.

fields.Name: Jellicent
fields.Pokedex: They propel themselves by expelling absorbed seawater from their bodies. Their favorite food is life energy.

fields.Name: Alomomola
fields.Pokedex: Floating in the open sea is how they live. When they find a wounded Pokémon, they embrace it and bring it to shore.

fields.Name: Joltik
fields.Pokedex: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

fields.Name: Galvantula
fields.Pokedex: They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.

fields.Name: Ferroseed
fields.Pokedex: They stick their spikes into cave walls and absorb the minerals they find in the rock.

fields.Name: Ferrothorn
fields.Pokedex: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.

fields.Name: Klink
fields.Pokedex: Interlocking two bodies and spinning around generates the energy they need to live.

fields.Name: Klang
fields.Pokedex: Spinning minigears are rotated at high speed and repeatedly fired away. It is dangerous if the gears don't return.

fields.Name: Klinklang
fields.Pokedex: The gear with the red core is rotated at high speed for a rapid energy charge.

fields.Name: Tynamo
fields.Pokedex: These Pokémon move in schools. They have an electricity-generating organ, so they discharge electricity if in danger.

fields.Name: Eelektrik
fields.Pokedex: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.

fields.Name: Eelektross
fields.Pokedex: With their sucker mouths, they suck in prey. Then they use their fangs to shock the prey with electricity.

fields.Name: Elgyem
fields.Pokedex: This Pokémon had never been seen until it appeared from far in the desert 50 years ago.

fields.Name: Beheeyem
fields.Pokedex: It uses psychic power to control an opponent's brain and tamper with its memories.

fields.Name: Litwick
fields.Pokedex: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leeches off the life force of any who follow it.

fields.Name: Lampent
fields.Pokedex: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.

fields.Name: Chandelure
fields.Pokedex: Being consumed in Chandelure's flame burns up the spirit, leaving the body behind.

fields.Name: Axew
fields.Pokedex: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.

fields.Name: Fraxure
fields.Pokedex: Their tusks can shatter rocks. Territory battles between Fraxure can be intensely violent.

fields.Name: Haxorus
fields.Pokedex: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokémon are covered in hard armor.

fields.Name: Cubchoo
fields.Pokedex: Its nose is always running. It sniffs the snot back up because the mucus provides the raw material for its moves.

fields.Name: Beartic
fields.Pokedex: It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice to fight with. Cold northern areas are its habitat.

fields.Name: Cryogonal
fields.Pokedex: They are born in snow clouds. They use chains made of ice crystals to capture prey.

fields.Name: Shelmet
fields.Pokedex: It evolves when bathed in an electric-like energy along with Karrablast. The reason is still unknown.

fields.Name: Accelgor
fields.Pokedex: Having removed its heavy shell, it becomes very light and can fight with ninja-like movements.

fields.Name: Stunfisk
fields.Pokedex: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of energy.

fields.Name: Mienfoo
fields.Pokedex: They have mastered elegant combos. As they concentrate, their battle moves become swifter and more precise.

fields.Name: Mienshao
fields.Pokedex: They use the long fur on their arms as a whip to strike their opponents.

fields.Name: Druddigon
fields.Pokedex: It races through narrow caves, using its sharp claws to catch prey. Then skin on its face is harder than a rock.

fields.Name: Golett
fields.Pokedex: These Pokémon are thought to have been created by the science of an ancient and mysterious civilization.

fields.Name: Golurk
fields.Pokedex: It is said that Golurk were ordered to protect people and Pokémon by the ancient people who made them.

fields.Name: Pawniard
fields.Pokedex: Descendiente de una larga estirpe de Bisharp que lucharon en los tercios españoles, entrena duro para llegar a ser tan diestro como sus antecesores.

fields.Name: Bisharp
fields.Pokedex: Algunos fueron contratados como mercenarios por los tercios españoles y con el tiempo adoptaron las ropas y técnicas de combate de estos soldados.

fields.Name: Bouffalant
fields.Pokedex: They charge wildly and headbutt everything. They headbutts have enough destructive force to derail a train.

fields.Name: Rufflet
fields.Pokedex: They will challenge anything, even strong opponents, without fear. Their frequent fights help them become stronger.

fields.Name: Braviary
fields.Pokedex: The more scars they have, the more respect these brave soldiers of the sky get from their peers.

fields.Name: Vullaby
fields.Pokedex: They tend to guard their posteriors with suitable bones they have found. They pursue weak Pokémon.

fields.Name: Mandibuzz
fields.Pokedex: Watching from the sky, they swoop to strike weakened Pokémon on the ground. They decorate themselves with bones.

fields.Name: Heatmor
fields.Pokedex: Using their very hot, flame-covered tongues, they burn through Durant's steel bodies and consume their insides.

fields.Name: Durant
fields.Pokedex: Durant dig nests in mountains. They build their complicated, interconnected tunnels in mazes.

fields.Name: Deino
fields.Pokedex: They cannot see, so they tackle and bite to learn about their surroundings. Their bodies are covered in wounds.

fields.Name: Zweilous
fields.Pokedex: Since their two heads do not get along and compete with each other for food, they always eat too much.

fields.Name: Hydreigon
fields.Pokedex: The heads on their arms do not have brains. They use all three heads to consume and destroy everything.

fields.Name: Larvesta
fields.Pokedex: The base of volcanoes is where they make their homes. They shoot fire from their five horns to repel attacking enemies.

fields.Name: Volcarona
fields.Pokedex: A sea of fire engulfs the surroundings of their battles, since they use their six wings to scatter their ember scales.

fields.Name: Cobalion
fields.Pokedex: It has a body and heart of steel. Its glare is sufficient to make even an unruly Pokémon obey it.

fields.Name: Terrakion
fields.Pokedex: Its charge is strong enough to break through a giant castle wall in one blow. This Pokémon is spoken of in legends.

fields.Name: Virizion
fields.Pokedex: Its head sprouts horns as sharp as blades. Using whirlwind-like movements, it confounds and swiftly cuts opponents.

fields.Name: Tornadus
fields.Pokedex: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.

fields.Name: Thundurus
fields.Pokedex: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.

fields.Name: Reshiram
fields.Pokedex: When Reshiram's tail flares, the heat energy moves the atmosphere and changes the world's weather.

fields.Name: Zekrom
fields.Pokedex: This Pokémon appears in legends. In its tail, it has a giant generator that creates electricity.

fields.Name: Landorus
fields.Pokedex: The energy that comes pouring from its tail increases the nutrition in the soil, making crops grow to great size.

fields.Name: Kyurem
fields.Pokedex: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

fields.Name: Keldeo
fields.Pokedex: It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of oceans and rivers. It appears at scenic waterfronts.

fields.Name: Meloetta
fields.Pokedex: Many famous songs have been inspired by the melodies that Meloetta plays.

fields.Name: Genesect
fields.Pokedex: This ancient bug Pokémon was altered by Team Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.

fields.Name: Chespin
fields.Pokedex: The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.

fields.Name: Quilladin
fields.Pokedex: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won't start fights.

fields.Name: Chesnaught
fields.Pokedex: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.

fields.Name: Fennekin
fields.Pokedex: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.

fields.Name: Braixen
fields.Pokedex: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.

fields.Name: Delphox
fields.Pokedex: It gazes into the flame at the tip of its branch to achieve a focused state, which allows it to see into the future.

fields.Name: Froakie
fields.Pokedex: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

fields.Name: Frogadier
fields.Pokedex: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.

fields.Name: Greninja
fields.Pokedex: It appears and vanishes with a ninja’s grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.

fields.Name: Bunnelby
fields.Pokedex: It has ears like shovels. Digging holes strengthens its ears so much that they can sever thick roots effortlessly.

fields.Name: Diggersby
fields.Pokedex: As powerful as an excavator, its ears can reduce dense bedrock to rubble. When it’s finished digging, it lounges lazily.

fields.Name: Fletchling
fields.Pokedex: These friendly Pokemon send signals to one another with beautiful chirps and tail-feather movements.

fields.Name: Fletchinder
fields.Pokedex: The hotter the flame sac on its belly, the faster it can fly, but it takes some time to get the fire going.

fields.Name: Talonflame
fields.Pokedex: In the fever of an exciting battle, it showers embers from the gaps between its feathers and takes to the air.

fields.Name: Scatterbug
fields.Pokedex: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.

fields.Name: Spewpa
fields.Pokedex: It lives hidden within thicket shadows. When predators attack, it quickly bristles the fur covering its body in an effort to threaten them.

fields.Name: Vivillon
fields.Pokedex: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.

fields.Name: Litleo
fields.Pokedex: They set off on their own from their pride and live by themselves to become stronger. These hot-blooded Pokémon are quick to fight.

fields.Name: Pyroar
fields.Pokedex: With fiery breath of more than 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, they viciously threaten any challenger. The females protect the pride’s cubs.

fields.Name: Flabebe
fields.Pokedex: When it finds a flower it likes, it dwells on that flower its whole life long. It floats in the wind’s embrace with an untroubled heart.

fields.Name: Floette
fields.Pokedex: It flutters around fields of flowers and cares for flowers that are starting to wilt. It draws out the power of flowers to battle.

fields.Name: Florges
fields.Pokedex: It claims exquisite flower gardens as its territory, and it obtains power from basking in the energy emitted by flowering plants.

fields.Name: Skiddo
fields.Pokedex: Thought to be one of the first Pokemon to live in harmony with humans, it has a placid disposition.

fields.Name: Gogoat
fields.Pokedex: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.

fields.Name: Pancham
fields.Pokedex: It does its best to be taken seriously by its enemies, but its glare is not sufficiently intimidating. Chewing on a leaf is its trademark.

fields.Name: Pangoro
fields.Pokedex: It charges ahead and bashes its opponents like a berserker, uncaring about any hits it might take. Its arms are mighty enough to snap a telephone pole.

fields.Name: Furfrou
fields.Pokedex: Historically, in the Kalos region, these Pokemon were the designated guardians of the king.

fields.Name: Espurr
fields.Pokedex: It has enough psychic energy to blast everything within 300 feet of itself, but it has no control over its power.

fields.Name: Meowstic
fields.Pokedex: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck to dust.

fields.Name: Honedge
fields.Pokedex: Apparently this Pokemon is born when a departed spirit inhabits a sword. It attaches itself to people and drinks their life force.

fields.Name: Doublade
fields.Pokedex: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an opponent greatly accomplished at swordplay.

fields.Name: Aegislash
fields.Pokedex: Apparently, it can detect the innate qualities of leadership. According to legend, whoever it recognizes is destined to become king.

fields.Name: Spritzee
fields.Pokedex: In the past, rather than using perfume, royal ladies carried a Spritzee that would waft a fragrance they liked.

fields.Name: Aromatisse
fields.Pokedex: Its scent is so overpowering that, unless a Trainer happens to really enjoy the smell, he or she will have a hard time walking alongside it.

fields.Name: Swirlix
fields.Pokedex: To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes white threads as sweet and as sticky as cotton candy.

fields.Name: Slurpuff
fields.Pokedex: Its sense of smell is 100 million times better than a human’s, so even the faintest scent tells it about everything in the area. It’s like it can see with its nose!

fields.Name: Inkay
fields.Pokedex: It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponent’s will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.

fields.Name: Malamar
fields.Pokedex: It lures its prey close with hypnotic motions, then wraps its tentacles around it before finishing it off with digestive fluids.

fields.Name: Binacle
fields.Pokedex: Two Binacle live together on one rock. When they fight, one of them will move to a different rock.

fields.Name: Barbaracle
fields.Pokedex: Barbaracle's legs and hands have minds of their own, and they will move independently. But they usually follow the head's orders.

fields.Name: Skrelp
fields.Pokedex: Camouflaged as rotten kelp, they spray liquid poison on prey that approaches unawares and then finish it off.

fields.Name: Dragalge
fields.Pokedex: Tales are told of ships that wander into seas where Dragalge live, never to return.

fields.Name: Clauncher
fields.Pokedex: They knock down flying prey by firing compressed water from their massive claws like shooting a pistol.

fields.Name: Clawitzer
fields.Pokedex: Their enormous claws launch cannonballs of water powerful enough to pierce tanker hulls.

fields.Name: Helioptile
fields.Pokedex: They make their home in desserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.

fields.Name: Heliolisk
fields.Pokedex: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficiant electricity to power a skyscraper.

fields.Name: Tyrunt
fields.Pokedex: Its immense jaws have enough destructive force that it can chew up an automobile It lived 100 million years ago.

fields.Name: Tyrantrum
fields.Pokedex: Nothing could stop this Pokemon 100 years ago, so it behaved like a king.

fields.Name: Amaura
fields.Pokedex: This ancient Pokemon was restored from part of its body that had been frozen in ice for over 100 million years.

fields.Name: Aurorus
fields.Pokedex: The diamond-shaped crystals on its body expel air as cold as -240 degrees Fahrenheit, surrounding its enemies and encasing them in ice.

fields.Name: Sylveon
fields.Pokedex: Es muy amistoso, cariñoso y alegre. Se preocupa por el bienestar de su entrenador sin poder evitarlo ya que presenta genes que lo incitan a ello.

fields.Name: Hawlucha
fields.Pokedex: Although its body is small, its proficient fighting skills enable it to keep up with big bruisers like Machamp and Hariyama.

fields.Name: Dedenne
fields.Pokedex: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.

fields.Name: Carbink
fields.Pokedex: It has slept underground for hundreds of millions of years since its birth. It's occasionally found during the excavation of caves.

fields.Name: Goomy
fields.Pokedex: The weakest Dragon-type Pokémon, it lives in damp, shady places, so its body doesn't dry out.

fields.Name: Sliggoo
fields.Pokedex: It drives away opponents by excreting a sticky liquid that can dissolve anything. Its eyes devolved, so it can't see anything.

fields.Name: Goodra
fields.Pokedex: This very friendly Dragon-type Pokemon will hug its beloved Trainer, leaving that Trainer covered in sticky slime.

fields.Name: Klefki
fields.Pokedex: It never lets go of a key that it likes, so people give it the keys to vaults and safes as a way to prevent crime.

fields.Name: Phantump
fields.Pokedex: According to old tales, these Pokémon are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died while lost in the forest.

fields.Name: Trevenant
fields.Pokedex: It can control trees at will. It will trap people who harm the forest, so they can never leave.

fields.Name: Pumpkaboo
fields.Pokedex: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.

fields.Name: Gourgeist
fields.Pokedex: It enwraps its prey in its hairlike arms. It sings joyfully as it observes the suffering of its prey.

fields.Name: Bergmite
fields.Pokedex: It blocks opponents' attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice.

fields.Name: Avalugg
fields.Pokedex: Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel. Its cumbersome frame crushes anything that stands in its way.

fields.Name: Noibat
fields.Pokedex: They live in pitch black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.

fields.Name: Noivern
fields.Pokedex: The ultrasonic waves it emits from its ears can reduce a large boulder to pebbles. It swoops out of the dark to attack.

fields.Name: Xerneas
fields.Pokedex: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.

fields.Name: Yveltal
fields.Pokedex: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

fields.Name: Zygarde
fields.Pokedex: It's hypothesized that it's monitoring those who destroy the ecosystem from deep in the cave where it lives.

fields.Name: Diancie
fields.Pokedex: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.

fields.Name: Hoopa
fields.Pokedex: It gathers things it likes and pushes them through its loop to teleport them to a secret place.

fields.Name: Volcanion
fields.Pokedex: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.

fields.Name: Rowlet
fields.Pokedex: This wary Pokémon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night.

fields.Name: Dartrix
fields.Pokedex: It spends its free time preening its wings. Its preoccupation with any dirt on its plumage can leave it unable to battle.

fields.Name: Decidueye
fields.Pokedex: It fires arrow quills from its wings with such precision, they can pierce a pebble from over hundred yards.

fields.Name: Litten
fields.Pokedex: While grooming itself, it build up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.

fields.Name: Torracat
fields.Pokedex: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever this Pokémon spits fire.

fields.Name: Incineroar
fields.Pokedex: This Pokémon has a violent, selfish disposition. When in a bad mood, it may ignore its Trainer's orders with complete nonchalance.

fields.Name: Popplio
fields.Pokedex: This Pokémon snorts body fluid from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. It's famous for being a hard worker.

fields.Name: Brionne
fields.Pokedex: A skillful dancer, it creates a sequence of water balloons as it dances, and briskly bombards its enemies.

fields.Name: Primarina
fields.Pokedex: It controls its water balloons by singing. The melody is learned from others of its kind and is passed down a generation.

fields.Name: Pikipek
fields.Pokedex: It can peck at a rate of 16 times a second to drill holes in trees. It uses the holes for food storage and nesting.

fields.Name: Trumbeak
fields.Pokedex: It eats berries and stores their seeds in its beak. When it encounters enemies or Prey, it fires off all the seeds in a burst.

fields.Name: Toucannon
fields.Pokedex: When it battles its beak heats up. The heat can easily exceed 100 degrees Celcius, causing severe burns when it hits.

fields.Name: Yungoos
fields.Pokedex: It wanders around in a never-ending search for food. At dusk, it collapses from exhaustioni and falls asleep on the spot.

fields.Name: Gumshoos
fields.Pokedex: When it finds a trace of its prey, it patiently stakes out the location, but it's always snoozing by nightfall.

fields.Name: Grubbin
fields.Pokedex: Vive en campos o bosques junto a centrales eléctricas. Usa sus potentes mandíbulas para penetrar la corteza de árboles y absorber la savia.

fields.Name: Charjabug
fields.Pokedex: Se mueve muy poco y almacena energía hasta que evoluciona, la cual puede transferirla a objetos u otros Pokémon como si fuera una batería.

fields.Name: Vikavolt
fields.Pokedex: Los machos combaten con sus mandíbulas para disputarse a las hembras. Éstas tras el apareamiento ponen sus huevos en huecos en la corteza de árboles.

fields.Name: Crabrawler
fields.Pokedex: It punches so much, its pincers often come off from overuse, but they grow back quickly.

fields.Name: Crabominable
fields.Pokedex: It aimed for the top but got lost and ended up on a snowy mountain. Being forced to endure the cold, this Pokémon evolved.

fields.Name: Oricorio
fields.Pokedex: It beats its wings together to create fire. As it moves in the steps of its beautiful dance, it bathes opponents in flames.

fields.Name: Cutiefly
fields.Pokedex: Because Cutiefly are able to sense auras, they can identify which flowers are about to bloom.

fields.Name: Ribombee
fields.Pokedex: It rolls up pollen into puffs. It makes many different varieties, some used as food and others for battle.

fields.Name: Rockruff
fields.Pokedex: It's a good Pokémon for beginners because of its friendlinless, but its disposition grows rougher as it grows up.

fields.Name: Lycanroc
fields.Pokedex: Its quick moves confuse its enemies. Well equipped with claws and fangs, it also uses the rocks in its mane as weapons.

fields.Name: Wishiwashi
fields.Pokedex: When in trouble, their eyes shine. The shining light attracts its comrades who will help them out.

fields.Name: Mareanie
fields.Pokedex: The coral that grows on Corsola's head is as good as a five-star banquet to this Pokémon.

fields.Name: Toxapex
fields.Pokedex: It crawls along the ocean floor on its 12 legs. It leaves a trail of Corsola bits scattered in its wake.

fields.Name: Mudbray
fields.Pokedex: The mud stuck to Mudbray's hooves enhances its grip and its powerful running gait.

fields.Name: Mudsdale
fields.Pokedex: It spits a mud that provides resistance to both wind and rain, so the walls of old houses were often coated with it.

fields.Name: Dewpider
fields.Pokedex: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.

fields.Name: Araquanid
fields.Pokedex: It delivers headbutts with the water bubbleon its head. Small Pokémon get sucked in the bubble and drown.

fields.Name: Fomantis
fields.Pokedex: During the day, it sleeps and soaks up light. When night falls, it walks around looking for a safer place to sleep.

fields.Name: Lurantis
fields.Pokedex: It fires beams from its petals. These beams are powerful enough to cleave through thick metal plates.

fields.Name: Morelull
fields.Pokedex: It scatters spores that flicker and glow. Anyone seeing these lights falls into a deep slumber.

fields.Name: Shiinotic
fields.Pokedex: Forests where Shiinotic live are treacherous to enter at night. People are confused by their lights and get lost.

fields.Name: Salandit
fields.Pokedex: It burns its bodily fluids to create poisonous gas. It attack its enemies once they inhale it.

fields.Name: Salazzle
fields.Pokedex: Filled with pheromones, its poisonous gas can be diluted to use in the production of perfumes.

fields.Name: Stufful
fields.Pokedex: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.

fields.Name: Bewear
fields.Pokedex: This immensely dangerous Pokémon possesses overwhelming strength. Its habitat is generally offlimits.

fields.Name: Bounsweet
fields.Pokedex: A delectable aroma pours from its body. They are often swallowed by birds lured by that wafting deliciousness.

fields.Name: Steenee
fields.Pokedex: The sepals on its head are quite hard, so even if pecked by bird Pokémon, this Pokémon is totally fine.

fields.Name: Tsareena
fields.Pokedex: Its long, striking legs aren't just for show but to be used to kick with skill.

fields.Name: Comfey
fields.Pokedex: It attaches flowers to its highly nutritious vine. This revitalizes the flower and give off an aromatic scent.

fields.Name: Oranguru
fields.Pokedex: Known for its intelligence, this Pokémon looks down on inexperienced Trainers, so it's best for veteran Trainers.

fields.Name: Passimian
fields.Pokedex: They form groups of about 20 individuals. Their mutual bond is remarkable - They will never let down a comrade.

fields.Name: Wimpod
fields.Pokedex: As it desperately dashes off, the flailing of its many legs leave a sparkling clean path in its wake.

fields.Name: Golisopod
fields.Pokedex: With a flashing slash of its giant sharp claws, it cleaves seawater - or even air - right into two.

fields.Name: Sandygast
fields.Pokedex: Born from a sand mound playfully built by a child, this Pokémon embodies the grudges of the departed.

fields.Name: Palossand
fields.Pokedex: Buried beneath the castle are masses of bones from those whose vitality it has drained.

fields.Name: Pyukumuku
fields.Pokedex: It can eject its internal organs, which it uses to engulf its prey or battle enemies.

fields.Name: Código Cero
fields.Pokedex: The heavy control mask it wears suppresses its capabilities. This Pokémon has some hidden special power.

fields.Name: Silvally
fields.Pokedex: Its trust in its partner is what awakens it. This Pokémon is capable of changing its type.

fields.Name: Minior
fields.Pokedex: Strong impacts can knock it out of its shell. This Pokémon was born from mutated nanoparticles.

fields.Name: Komala
fields.Pokedex: The log it holds was give to it by its parents. It is also known to cling to the arm of a friendly Trainer.

fields.Name: Turtonator
fields.Pokedex: The shell on its back is chemically unstable and explodes violently. The hole in its stomach is its weak point.

fields.Name: Togedemaru
fields.Pokedex: The long hairs on its back act as lightning rods. The bolts of lightning it attracts are stored as energy.

fields.Name: Mimikyu
fields.Pokedex: Its actual appearance is unknown. When a scholar saw what was under its rag, it was overwhelmed by terror and died.

fields.Name: Bruxish
fields.Pokedex: It stuns its prey with psychokinesis and then grinds them to mush with its strong teeth.

fields.Name: Drampa
fields.Pokedex: It has a compassionate personality, but when angered, it completely destroys its surroundings with its breath.

fields.Name: Dhelmise
fields.Pokedex: Swinging its massive anchor, it can KO Wailord in a single blow. What appears to be green seaweed is actually its body.

fields.Name: Jangmo-o
fields.Pokedex: It expresses its feelings by smacking its scales. Metallic sounds echo through the tall mountains where it lives.

fields.Name: Hakamo-o
fields.Pokedex: It leaps at its prey with a courageous shout. Its scaly punches can tear its opponents to shreds.

fields.Name: Kommo-o
fields.Pokedex: When it spots enemies, it threatens them by jingling its scales. Weak opponents will crack and flee in panic.

fields.Name: Tapu Koko
fields.Pokedex: This guardian deity of Melemele is brimming with curiosity. It summons thunderclouds and stores their lightning.

fields.Name: Tapu Lele
fields.Pokedex: This guardian deity of Akala is guilelessly cruel. The fragrant aroma of flowers is the source of its energy.

fields.Name: Tapu Bulu
fields.Pokedex: This guardian deity of Ula'ula is lazy. It commands plants to immobilize its foes and then hits them with its horns.

fields.Name: Tapu Fini
fields.Pokedex: This guardian deity of Poni controls water. They say it can create pure water that will wash away any uncleanness.

fields.Name: Cosmog
fields.Pokedex: Its body is gaseous and frail. It slowsly grows as it collects dust from the atmosphere.

fields.Name: Cosmoem
fields.Pokedex: Motionless as if dead, its body is faintly warm to the touch. In the distant past, it was called the cocoon of stars.

fields.Name: Solgaleo
fields.Pokedex: At activation of its third eye, it departs for another world where it is said to live.

fields.Name: Lunala
fields.Pokedex: When its third eye activates, away it flies to another world where it is said to live.

fields.Name: Magearna
fields.Pokedex: This artificial Pokémon, more than 500 years old, can understand human speech but cannot speak itself.

fields.Name: Marshadow
fields.Pokedex: Able to conceal itself in shadows, it never appears before human, so its very existence was the stuff of myth.

fields.Name: Snampery
fields.Pokedex: De carácter humilde, su pasatiempo favorito es tomar el sol para cargarse de energía. Puede ser mucho más activo de lo que aparenta.

fields.Name: Descargot
fields.Pokedex: Almacena energía solar a través de sus antenas y la convierte en energía eléctrica. Le encanta la tranquilidad y atacará a quien se atreva a perturbarle.

fields.Name: Gastesla
fields.Pokedex: Almacena energía solar a través de sus antenas y la convierte en energía eléctrica. Le encanta la tranquilidad y atacará a quien se atreva a perturbarle.

fields.Name: Flasinge
fields.Pokedex: De hábitos nocturnos, le encanta contemplar la luna. Se cree que su poder aumenta en las noches de luna llena.

fields.Name: Shaboon
fields.Pokedex: Se les ha visto reunirse en manada en torno a la luna para realizar extrañas danzas rituales. Posee una enorme inteligencia.

fields.Name: Lunaye
fields.Pokedex: Su fuerza física es descomunal, embiste rodeado de llamas y es capaz de derribar edificios con sus potentes golpes. Es recomendable no enfadarle demasiado.

fields.Name: Swolphin
fields.Pokedex: Como su medio natural son las aguas frías del norte, no termina de adaptarse bien a caminar por tierra. Es territorial y protegerá lo suyo hasta el final.

fields.Name: Norspear
fields.Pokedex: Dicen que una pelea entre dos Norspear podría romper un iceberg. Es muy invasivo y conquistará cualquier territorio que le beneficie.

fields.Name: Narvalor
fields.Pokedex: Numerosas leyendas negras rodean a este perturbador Pokemon, que acaba con sus víctimas sumiéndoles en la locura. Se le relaciona con el fin del mundo.

fields.Name: Missingno
fields.Pokedex: La Pokedex no tiene información sobre este Pokemon.

fields.Name: Necrozma
fields.Pokedex: Light is the source of its energy. If it isn't devouring light, impurities build up in it and on it, and Necrozma darkens and stops moving.

fields.Name: Zeraora
fields.Pokedex: Se acerca a sus enemigos a la velocidad del rayo, luego los descuartiza con sus afiladas garras.

fields.Name: Cefireon
fields.Pokedex: Se ha hecho uno con el viento y ahora es capaz de dominarlo a voluntad. Vuela a gran velocidad atravesando nubes y tormentas.

fields.Name: Meltan
fields.Pokedex: La mayor parte del cuerpo de Meltan está compuesta de metal líquido, lo que le confiere una silueta maleable y fluida.

fields.Name: Melmetal
fields.Pokedex: En la antigüedad, este Pokémon se ganó la adoración de la gente gracias a su capacidad para crear metal.

fields.Name: Grookey
fields.Pokedex: Al marcar el ritmo con su baqueta especial, produce unas ondas sonoras capaces de devolver la vitalidad a la flora.

fields.Name: Thwackey
fields.Pokedex: Los Thwackey que marcan el ritmo más contundente con sus dos baquetas son los más respetados por sus congéneres.

fields.Name: Rillaboom
fields.Pokedex: El percusionista con la técnica más depurada se convierte en líder. Son de carácter tranquilo y dan mucha importancia a la armonía del grupo.

fields.Name: Scorbunny
fields.Pokedex: Se pone a correr para elevar su temperatura corporal y propagar la energía ígnea por todo el cuerpo. Desata así su verdadera fuerza.

fields.Name: Raboot
fields.Pokedex: Su suave pelaje lo protege del frío y le permite incrementar todavía más la temperatura de sus movimientos de tipo Fuego.

fields.Name: Cinderace
fields.Pokedex: Convierte piedras en balones de fuego dándoles toques y, luego, chuta con fuerza hacia el rival para chamuscarlo.

fields.Name: Sobble
fields.Pokedex: Cuando se espanta, libera unas lágrimas con un factor lacrimógeno equivalente a 100 cebollas para hacer llorar también al rival.

fields.Name: Drizzile
fields.Pokedex: Crea bolas de agua con el líquido que segrega por las palmas de las manos y las usa en combate de forma estratégica.

fields.Name: Inteleon
fields.Pokedex: Dispara chorros de agua por la punta de los dedos a 3 mach de velocidad. Con su membrana nictitante puede ver los puntos débiles del rival.

fields.Name: Skwovet
fields.Pokedex: Siempre están comiendo bayas, por lo que son más robustos de lo que aparentan. Frecuentan los huertos en busca de su preciado manjar.

fields.Name: Greedent
fields.Pokedex: Se obceca tanto en acumular bayas en la cola que no se da ni cuenta de cuando tiene demasiadas y se le acaban cayendo.

fields.Name: Rookidee
fields.Pokedex: De naturaleza valiente, planta cara a cualquier rival, por muy fuerte que sea. Los contraataques que recibe le sirven para fortalecerse.

fields.Name: Corvisquire
fields.Pokedex: Su inteligencia le permite servirse de objetos. Por ejemplo, recoge y lanza piedras con las patas, o utiliza cuerdas para atrapar a su oponente.

fields.Name: Corviknight
fields.Pokedex: No tiene rival en los cielos. El acero negro y lustroso de su cuerpo intimida a cualquier adversario.

fields.Name: Blipbug
fields.Pokedex: Siempre está recopilando información, por lo que es muy inteligente, aunque su fuerza deja bastante que desear.

fields.Name: Dottler
fields.Pokedex: Apenas se mueve, pero está vivo. Se cree que adquiere poderes psíquicos mientras permanece recluido en su caparazón sin comer ni beber.

fields.Name: Orbeetle
fields.Pokedex: Este Pokémon es conocido por su inteligencia. El gran tamaño de su cerebro es un indicio de la magnitud de sus poderes psíquicos.

fields.Name: Nickit
fields.Pokedex: Marca a su presa sin ser advertido. Sigue el olor y, cuando el Pokémon baja la guardia, aprovecha para robarle.

fields.Name: Thievul
fields.Pokedex: Un Pokémon ágil y de afiladas garras que se alimenta de huevos y comida robados. Los Boltund son su enemigo natural.

fields.Name: Gossifleur
fields.Pokedex: Si planta su única extremidad inferior en la tierra y se expone a abundante luz solar, sus pétalos cobran un color vivo.

fields.Name: Eldegoss
fields.Pokedex: Las semillas que tiene entre la pelusa son muy nutritivas. Arrastradas por el viento, devuelven la vitalidad a la flora y a otros Pokémon.

fields.Name: Wooloo
fields.Pokedex: Su lana rizada es tan acolchada que no se hace daño ni aunque se caiga por un precipicio.

fields.Name: Dubwool
fields.Pokedex: Su lana es muy flexible. Las alfombras tejidas con ella adoptan una textura similar a la de las camas elásticas.

fields.Name: Chewtle
fields.Pokedex: Muerde todo lo que se le ponga por delante. Al parecer, lo hace para aliviar el dolor que siente cuando le crecen los incisivos.

fields.Name: Drednaw
fields.Pokedex: Un Pokémon de temperamento feroz que amenaza a su presa con sus fuertes mandíbulas, capaces de destrozar una barra de hierro.

fields.Name: Yamper
fields.Pokedex: Son muy glotones, por lo que ayudan a la gente a cambio de comida. Echan chispas al correr.

fields.Name: Boltund
fields.Pokedex: La electricidad que genera y envía a sus patas le ayuda a desplazarse rápidamente. Puede correr sin descanso durante tres días y tres noches.

fields.Name: Rolycoly
fields.Pokedex: Fue descubierto hace aproximadamente 400 años en una mina. Casi la totalidad de su cuerpo presenta una composición igual a la del carbón.

fields.Name: Carkol
fields.Pokedex: Gira la patas a gran velocidad para correr a unos 30 km/h. Emite llamas a una temperatura de 1000ºC.

fields.Name: Coalossal
fields.Pokedex: Aunque es de carácter sereno, monta en cólera si ve a seres humanos dañando una mina y reduce todo a cenizas con sus llamas a 1500 ºC.

fields.Name: Applin
fields.Pokedex: Habita durante toda su vida en el interior de una manzana. Finge ser una fruta para protegerse de los Pokémon pájaro, sus enemigos naturales.

fields.Name: Flapple
fields.Pokedex: Ha evolucionado tras ingerir una manzana ácida. Las bolsas de las mejillas albergan un fluido cuya extrema acidez llega a provocar quemaduras.

fields.Name: Appletun
fields.Pokedex: Ha evolucionado tras ingerir una manzana dulce. De ahí que el olor que emana para atraer a sus presas, los Pokémon insecto, sea tan agradable.

fields.Name: Silicobra
fields.Pokedex: Almacena la arena que ingiere al perforar hoyos en la saca del cuello, cuya capacidad llega a alcanzar incluso los 8 kg.

fields.Name: Sandaconda
fields.Pokedex: Se retuerce para expulsar por los orificios nasales hasta 100 kg de arena. La ausencia de esta mina su ánimo.

fields.Name: Cramorant
fields.Pokedex: Traga Arrokuda enteros debido a su glotonería, tan notable que en ocasiones ingiere hasta otros Pokémon sin querer.

fields.Name: Arrokuda
fields.Pokedex: Se siente muy orgulloso de su afilada mandíbula. En cuanto detecta el más mínimo movimiento, va directo al objetivo para cargar contra él.

fields.Name: Barraskewda
fields.Pokedex: Su mandíbula es tan puntiaguda como una lanza y tan dura como el acero. Al parecer, su carne es sorprendentemente deliciosa.

fields.Name: Toxel
fields.Pokedex: Segrega toxinas por la piel y las almacena en una bolsa de veneno interna. Tocarlo da calambre.

fields.Name: Toxtricity
fields.Pokedex: Cuando rasga las protuberancias del pecho para generar energía eléctrica, emite un sonido similar al de una guitarra, que reverbera en el entorno.

fields.Name: Sizzlipede
fields.Pokedex: Genera calor consumiendo el gas inflamable que almacena en su cuerpo. Los círculos amarillos del abdomen están particularmente calientes.

fields.Name: Centiskorch
fields.Pokedex: Cuando genera calor, su temperatura corporal alcanza aproximadamente los 800°C. Usa el cuerpo a modo de látigo para lanzarse al ataque.

fields.Name: Clobbopus
fields.Pokedex: Emerge a tierra firme en busca de alimento. Su extrema curiosidad lo induce a golpear con los tentáculos todo lo que entra en su campo visual.

fields.Name: Grapploct
fields.Pokedex: Todo su cuerpo es una mole de puro músculo. Utiliza los tentáculos para ejecutar técnicas de estrangulamiento con una formidable potencia.

fields.Name: Sinistea
fields.Pokedex: La espiral de su cuerpo líquido es su punto débil. Si se remueve, su complexión se desestabiliza y siente vértigo.

fields.Name: Polteageist
fields.Pokedex: Se hospeda en teteras dignas de un anticuario. Las originales son escasísimas, pero existe un gran número de burdas falsificaciones.

fields.Name: Hatenna
fields.Pokedex: Percibe los sentimientos de los seres vivos con la protuberancia de la cabeza. Solo abre su corazón a quienes muestren un carácter sosegado.

fields.Name: Hattrem
fields.Pokedex: Silencia a cualquiera que muestre una emoción intensa sin importar de quién se trate y recurre para ello a métodos a cuál más violento.

fields.Name: Hatterene
fields.Pokedex: Recibe el apodo de Hechicera del Bosque. Quienes arman demasiado barullo se exponen a ser despedazados por las garras de su tentáculo.

fields.Name: Impidimp
fields.Pokedex: Con el fin de revitalizarse, inhala por la nariz la energía negativa que desprenden tanto personas como Pokémon cuando están descontentos.

fields.Name: Morgrem
fields.Pokedex: Su estrategia consiste en postrarse ante el rival y fingir una disculpa para ensartarlo con el mechón que tiene en la espalda, afilado como lanza.

fields.Name: Grimmsnarl
fields.Pokedex: Cuando enrolla sus cabellos por todo el cuerpo, aumenta su potencia muscular. Posee una fuerza capaz de someter a Machamp.

fields.Name: Obstagoon
fields.Pokedex: Evoluciona tras haber librado numerosas peleas. El grito de guerra que profiere mientras pone los brazos en cruz atemoriza a cualquier rival.

fields.Name: Milcery
fields.Pokedex: Su cremoso cuerpo surgió a partir de la unión de partículas odoríferas de dulces aromas presentes en el aire.

fields.Name: Alcremie
fields.Pokedex: La nata que le brota de las manos es más dulce y sustanciosa cuando está feliz.

fields.Name: Falinks
fields.Pokedex: Este Pokémon consta de cinco subalternos y un líder, cuyas órdenes obedecen sin rechistar.

fields.Name: Pincurchin
fields.Pokedex: Libera electricidad por la punta de las púas. Con sus afilados dientes raspa las algas pegadas a las rocas para ingerirlas.

fields.Name: Snom
fields.Pokedex: Teje un hilo gélido que le permite aferrarse a las ramas y simula ser un carámbano mientras duerme.

fields.Name: Frosmoth
fields.Pokedex: La temperatura de sus alas es de -180°C. Sobrevuela el campo esparciendo sus gélidas escamas, como si de nieve se tratase.

fields.Name: Stonjourner
fields.Pokedex: Una vez al año y en una fecha concreta, tienen la costumbre de aparecer de la nada para reunirse y formar un círculo.

fields.Name: Eiscue
fields.Pokedex: Se enfría constantemente la cara con hielo por su escasa resistencia al calor. Utiliza el pelo de la cabeza para pescar en el mar.

fields.Name: Indeedee
fields.Pokedex: Con sus cuernos percibe las emociones de los seres vivos que se hallen cerca. Los sentimientos positivos constituyen su fuente de energía.

fields.Name: Morpeko
fields.Pokedex: Siempre tiene apetito, sin importar lo mucho que coma. Lleva con sumo cuidado las semillas que ha tostado con su propia electricidad.

fields.Name: Cufant
fields.Pokedex: Su constitución fornida le permite transportar sin inmutarse cargas de 5 toneladas. Utiliza la trompa para excavar la tierra.

fields.Name: Copperajah
fields.Pokedex: Su piel verdosa es resistente al agua. Proviene de tierras lejanas y presta ayuda a las personas en la realización de ciertos trabajos.

fields.Name: Dracozolt
fields.Pokedex: La robustez de su tren inferior lo hacía invencible en la antigüedad, pero se extinguió tras comerse todas las plantas de las que se nutría.

fields.Name: Arctozolt
fields.Pokedex: Antiguamente vivía en el mar y usaba el hielo del cuerpo para conservar los alimentos. Su extrema lentitud, sin embargo, lo condenó a la extinción.

fields.Name: Dracovish
fields.Pokedex: Su excelente capacidad motriz y la fuerza de su mandíbula lo hacían antaño invencible, pero dar caza a todas sus presas propició su extinción.

fields.Name: Arctovish
fields.Pokedex: Aunque la piel de su rostro era capaz de resistir cualquier ataque, su dificultad para respirar acabó provocando su extinción.

fields.Name: Duraludon
fields.Pokedex: Su cuerpo, similar a un metal pulido, es tan ligero como robusto. Sin embargo, tiene el defecto de que se oxida con facilidad.

fields.Name: Dreepy
fields.Pokedex: Habitaba los mares en tiempos inmemoriales. Ha revivido en forma de Pokémon de tipo Fantasma para vagar por su antigua morada.

fields.Name: Drakloak
fields.Pokedex: Vuela a una velocidad de 200 km/h. Lucha junto a un Dreepy, al que cuida hasta el momento de su evolución.

fields.Name: Dragapult
fields.Pokedex: Al parecer, los Dreepy que residen en sus cuernos esperan con ilusión el momento de ser propulsados a velocidad supersónica.

fields.Name: Mr. Rime
fields.Pokedex: Es un bailarín consumado de claqué. Agita su bastón de hielo mientras exhibe su destreza con gráciles pasos.

fields.Name: Sirfetch'd
fields.Pokedex: Solo los Farfetch’d que han vivido numerosas batallas son capaces de alcanzar esta evolución. Cuando su puerro se marchita, abandona los combates.

fields.Name: Cursola
fields.Pokedex: Su energía espiritual ha aumentado hasta hacerlo desprenderse de su base caliza. Protege el alma del núcleo con su cuerpo espectral.

fields.Name: Zacian
fields.Pokedex: Este Pokémon está considerado como un héroe de leyenda. Absorbe el metal para transformarlo y emplearlo como armamento.

fields.Name: Zamazenta
fields.Pokedex: Este Pokémon se erigió en salvador de Galar, tras unir fuerzas con un rey de los hombres. Absorbe el metal para utilizarlo en combate.

fields.Name: Eternatus
fields.Pokedex: Se alimenta de la energía que brota de la tierra de Galar absorbiéndola por el núcleo del pecho.

fields.Name: Lupice
fields.Pokedex: An extremely cautious Pokémon. It cloaks its body with its fluffy ear fur when it senses danger.

fields.Name: Mossfoot
fields.Pokedex: It whips up blizzards in mountains that are always buried in snow. It is the abominable snowman.

fields.Name: Astrem
fields.Pokedex: Un Pokémon amigo de la humanidad. Se aparece en los sueños de los entrenadores fuertes para advertirles de peligros que están por venir.

fields.Name: Maidible
fields.Pokedex: Its giant jaws are actually steel horns that transformed. It fools foes into complacency with its adorable gestures, then chomps them with its huge jaws.

fields.Name: Zippectre
fields.Pokedex: An abandoned plush doll became this Pokémon. They are said to live in garbage dumps and wander about in search of the children that threw them away.

fields.Name: Soundow
fields.Pokedex: Its auditory sense is astounding. It has a radar-like ability to understand its surrounding through slight sounds.

fields.Name: Nihilego
fields.Pokedex: Se desconoce si este Ultraente posee consciencia propia, pero en ocasiones se comporta como una chica joven.

fields.Name: Buzzwole
fields.Pokedex: Un Ultraente procedente de otro mundo. Se desconoce si exhibe su robusto cuerpo a modo de amenaza o para que lo admiren.

fields.Name: Pheromosa
fields.Pokedex: Este Ultraente se muestra reacio al contacto, probablemente porque percibe inmundicia en todo cuanto le rodea.

fields.Name: Xurkitree
fields.Pokedex: Uno de los llamados Ultraentes. Algunos ejemplares plantan sus extremidades en el suelo como si fueran árboles y permanecen inmóviles.

fields.Name: Celesteela
fields.Pokedex: Varios testigos afirman haber visto como este Ultraente carbonizaba un bosque entero con el gas expelido por sus extremidades.

fields.Name: Kartana
fields.Pokedex: El cuerpo de este Ultraente es fino como el papel y tan cortante como una espada recién afilada.

fields.Name: Guzzlord
fields.Pokedex: Se dice que este Ultraente ha sido avistado devorando montañas enteras y tragándose prominentes edificios.

fields.Name: Poipole
fields.Pokedex: En su mundo, este Ultraente se considera tan entrañable como para ser elegido compañero de viaje.

fields.Name: Naganadel
fields.Pokedex: Una de las temibles criaturas conocidas como Ultraentes. En su cuerpo almacena cientos de litros de veneno.

fields.Name: Stakataka
fields.Pokedex: Extraña criatura que podría ser un Ultraente. Parece un muro rocoso hasta que se mueve de repente y ataca.

fields.Name: Blacephalon
fields.Pokedex: Se desliza hacia la gente. Entonces, sin previo aviso, desencadena la explosión de su propia cabeza. Aparentemente es un tipo de Ultraente.

fields.Name: Unktena
fields.Pokedex: Se arrastra por el cosmos consumiendo todo lo que encuentra. No se detendrá hasta que el universo haya sido destruido.

fields.Name: Polekin
fields.Pokedex: Potro y micelio se han fusionado desde el nacimiento produciéndose una simbiosis muy estrecha, de manera que han formado una única especie Pokémon.

fields.Name: Fungorse
fields.Pokedex: La parte fúngica aporta protección a la simbiosis con sus esporas e hifas afiladas, mientras que la parte equina aporta nutrientes y desplazamiento.

fields.Name: Cervantrier
fields.Pokedex: La simbiosis lo convierte en un matadragones nato, varios autores se han basado en él para escribir muchas de sus obras caballerescas.

fields.Name: Lugnis
fields.Pokedex: Hasta que aprende a cazar se alimenta de presas que su madre regurgita para él. Sus padres le enseñan muy pronto a usar el fuego de forma responsable.

fields.Name: Luravit
fields.Pokedex: Es un gran carnívoro depredador y solo se alimenta de presas que él mismo caza. Es un experto usando con cuidado y en su beneficio el fuego que produce.

fields.Name: Luxpiravit
fields.Pokedex: Pokémon autóctono de Iberia que alcanza los 180cm de altura. Magnifico cazador que acecha en las sombras y ataca sin producir apenas ningún ruido.

fields.Name: Quisquite
fields.Pokedex: Pokémon crustáceo muy pequeño. Se esconde en la arena de las orillas de las playas para protegerse de sus depredadores, como Wingull o Remoraid.

fields.Name: Gambarrel
fields.Pokedex: Su cuerpo aún no es muy robusto, por lo que se protege con un barril. Salen de noche para alimentarse y cazan pequeños Pokémon pez.

fields.Name: Bogaleon
fields.Pokedex: Su exoesqueleto es muy duro, lo cual le permitió salir del barril y reforzar sus extremidades. Vive en pecios y asimila trozos de ellos en su organismo.

fields.Name: Runerigus
fields.Pokedex: They pretend to be elaborate coffins to teach lessons to grave robbers. Their bodies are covered in pure gold.

fields.Name: Perrserker
fields.Pokedex: Lo que aparenta ser un yelmo de hierro, es realmente su pelaje. Este Pokémon vive dedicado a la emoción del combate.

fields.Name: Kubfu
fields.Pokedex: Al tirar de los mechones blancos de la cabeza, acrecienta su espíritu luchador y empieza a acumular fuerza en el órgano de su bajo vientre.

fields.Name: Urshifu
fields.Pokedex: Vive en en zonas montañosas en áreas recónditas, donde entrena corriendo por escarpados riscos para fortalecer sus piernas y refinar su técnica.

fields.Name: Zarude
fields.Pokedex: Las lianas que le brotan del cuerpo nutren y fertilizan el mantillo del bosque cuando se le desprenden.

fields.Name: Regieleki
fields.Pokedex: Su cuerpo entero es energía eléctrica. Por lo visto, quitarle los anillos que lleva libera su poder oculto.

fields.Name: Regidrago
fields.Pokedex: Todo su cuerpo es una gema de energía dragón cristalizada. Se cree que posee los poderes de todos los Pokémon dragón.

fields.Name: Glastrier
fields.Pokedex: Cuenta con una fuerza física sobrecogedora. La máscara de hielo que le cubre el rostro es cien veces más dura que el diamante.

fields.Name: Spectrier
fields.Pokedex: Examina su entorno con todos los sentidos, salvo la vista. Se dice que sus coces son capaces de robarle el alma a quien las recibe.

fields.Name: Calyrex
fields.Pokedex: Un Pokémon muy compasivo agraciado con el poder de la curación. Reinó en Galar en tiempos remotos.

fields.Name: Kleavor
fields.Pokedex: A Scizor has a body with the hardness of steel. It is not easily fazed by ordinary sorts of attacks. It flaps its wings to regulate its body temperature.

fields.Name: Wyrdeer
fields.Pokedex: Stantler's magnificent antlers were once traded at high prices as works of art. As a result, this Pokémon was hunted close to extinction.

fields.Name: Basculegion
fields.Pokedex: Red and blue Basculin usually do not get along, but sometimes members of one school mingle with the other's schooL.

fields.Name: Overqwil
fields.Pokedex: A Qwilfish uses the pressure of water it swallows to shoot toxic quills all at once from all over its body. It finds swimming to be somewhat challenging.

fields.Name: Sneasler
fields.Pokedex: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.
